requiredbulletpoints.bulletpoint: Excelled as a Unity generalist software engineer, crafting gameplay for Virtual Virtual Reality 2 and Stranger Things VR, released on Meta Quest, Rift, and SteamVR.

bulletpoints.bulletpoint: Created and owned game mechanics in 'Stranger Things VR,' enabling immersive interactions with characters and telekinetic powers, expanding the game’s narrative world and appeal.
Implemented device-specific controls and tutorials in multiple titles, ensuring smooth cross-platform play on Meta Quest, SteamVR, and Meta Rift, enhancing user accessibility.
Delivered four additional rhythm game levels on time for VVR2’s 'Music Update,' playtested rigorously, contributing to a rise in new users post-update.
Built a scalable rhythm game engine for Tender Claws’ VR titles, structuring it for reusability and modularity across various gameplay designs, optimizing future development.
Collaborated with artist and QA lead to release VVR2’s 'Music Update,' implementing, debugging, and refining levels for a polished final product that boosted player engagement.
Produced subtitle generation tools for multiple language support, automating verification processes and reducing errors, significantly enhancing global accessibility.
Adapted to urgent publisher requests, quickly resolving bugs to maintain the quality and performance standards of 'Stranger Things VR.'
Designed VR gameplay mechanics for 'Stranger Things VR,' enabling players to navigate dreams, memories, and possess minds, expanding the immersive experience of the game.
Conducted extensive playtesting for rhythm game mechanics, gathering player feedback to refine difficulty levels and ensure an engaging experience for diverse player skill levels.
Resolved high-priority bugs swiftly, balancing speed with precision to meet publishing deadlines without compromising game quality.
